name: Hyatt Regency Sharm El Sheikh Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the Hyatt and it was one of the most brilliant holidays we have had. The airport was somewhat chaotic at Sharm but the queues moved quite quickly. The transfer to the hotel was by mini-bus and we only had to drop off two other couples before moving on to the hotel. The hotel has very impressive palm tree lined drive and looked beautiful even in the dark. Having upgraded to the Regency Club we were whizzed off on a golf cart to the club house to be checked in. The club house is very civilised and you get free canapes and drinks (spirits included) every day 17.30 - 19.30. The breakfast is continental but very good with lots of fresh fruit etc.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fab and was facing the Red Sea with lovely white Egyptian cotton bedding and lots of bathroom products. We were impressed by the fact that the hotel looks exactly like their website and wasn't just clever photography. Everywhere is spotless and the staff just seem to be constantly cleaning especially the main lobby where the marble floor looks like glass.
reviews.title: Hyatt's the best all round

likes.disliked: — A little tired in certain areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Regency Club has its own private pool and beach area, at the pool the pool-boys will bring drinks for you (soft drinks & water free of charge) and throughout the day they brought cold towels, fresh fruit and nothing was too much trouble. As we had read so much about this hotel we took some American Dollars for tipping. We tipped at the pool 2 dollars a day,they looked after us like Royalty. Every morning our sunbeds where ready with extra towel (which we had asked for on the first day) and our favorite spot. The beach has fantastic snorkelling, I was really worried about the jelly fish (the pinky purple ones do not sting - just gently push then out of the way). It was like being in an aquarium unbelievable colours both fish and coral. Many of the diving trips actually come to the front of the hotel so there if you dive there is no need to move further afield really and there is a dive centre at the hotel. We hired snorkelling equipment and you can keep it until 5.00pm.
reviews.title: Lovely landscape and snorkling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the Sala Thai restaurant twice, the first time we managed to get a table on the terrace - the view and the ambience here is lovely but you must book as it is quite famous in Sharm. We had breakfast at Cafe Fresco a couple of times, this was lovely also and we didn't find this too busy as some of the reviews we had read. There is more of a choice here but as we were eating lunch and dinner also we felt that the Regency breakfast was more than ample. The dress code throughout the hotel in the evening is casual/smart with 3/4 trs for men acceptable in all restaurants apart from the Sala Thai where you must wear long.
reviews.title: Go Regency Club!

reviews.text: A quick review - tip where you can the staff have very poor wages and really appreciate it. We ate in all the restaurants and found food very good. You do not need a visa if staying in and around Sharm. The wine is very expensive (we took a box in our luggage for drinks on our terrace)
reviews.title: Five Star Prices - Three Star Hotel

likes.liked: — The in room refrigerator, that was about all that could be described as adequate.
likes.disliked: — Staff, prices, in-room insects, location, beach, food, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency as a honeymoon and had upgraded to the regency club prior to the visit. This was well worth it and would definitely reccommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: General - The hotel was very nice by Egyptian standards as have stayed elsewhere in Sharm and there was no comparison. The main hotel area was was clean and well kept. Reception were superb and very helpful. Taxis and hotel cars into Naama bay/the airport were always available and cost around £3-4 Egyptian Pounds to Naama Bay. Airport was £15 in a hotel limo and can be arranged directly with the hotel before getting to Sharm as we did.
reviews.title: Hyatt Sharm El Sheikh
Nice for one time
reviews.text: Beach/Pools - The main pool was nice and there was plenty of space/beds around the pool. There was also a lazy river and a water slide. Regency club has its own pool which was pretty empty when we were there. Meals and drinks are served to the sun beds, towels are already layed out and cold flanels and fresh fruit and offered every now and then. The main beach is pretty large with a jetty over the coral and plenty of fish to see in the natural bay off the beach. There a few floating pontoons aswell to rest on. The regency beach was again quiet with its own bar/restaurant. Was tricky getting into the sea at low tide as there wasn't a jetty but was fine at high tide. Staff on the beach were really helpful and layed out beds in advance for a tip here and there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bars/Restaurants - The main bar is a fairly quiet which is the only complaint I have about the resort. Entertainment is limited in the bar aswell. The Souk restaurant (£10 per head) had a good variety of food in one place and can eat as much or little as wanted. The Sala Thai (£10 per head) was fantastic, a great thai restaurant and service was superb. The buffet restaurant (£15 per head) was as can be expected. Plenty of choice for anyone and did seem fresh. A seafood restaurant was available on the beach a couple of nights a week with a superb setting and lovely fresh choice of fish. It was also great just for a drink. We tended to eat in the hotel then head into Naama Bay at night where it was more lively.
reviews.title: Holiday of a lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regency Club - The room was fantastic, right on the front of the sea, around 100m walk to the regency club beach. The regency club house was great for breakfast, which was free. Continental breakfast but enough choice, really fresh and great service. The staff in the regency club are fantastic, they can't do enough for you (Even fetching some bananas from the kitchens mid morning when asked). The evening drinks and canapes wasn't as pretentious as we thought it would be be. It was pretty laid back and involves beers, spirits and wines to help yourself from aswell as snacks.
reviews.title: Not as good as previously

likes.disliked: — One of the pools being refurbished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location (despite being on the flight path). We stayed in a Regency Club room with great sea views. However, all beware. The hotel is overun with children who's parents paid little interest in controlling them; meal times often became a kindergarden. The vast majority of the guests appeared to be Russian with the odd European - seemed to be very few British guests.
reviews.title: If you love Children, this is the one for you!

reviews.text: The Club lounge likewise was more a playground, with the furniture doubling up as climbing frames. The staff, whilst helpful and polite seemed inexperienced and reluctant to step in - despite guests complaining. Our room was poorly maintained (took the hotel 3 days to fix the ceiling fan and TV, the shower was blocked, basic stuff like shampoos, tea and coffee were not replenished unless you asked).
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: We will not be returning; generally a very poor offering from Hyatt who need to sort out their local management!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can i say, this is the most beautiful hotel, with the most helpful courteous staff. This is our 4th visit to the Regency Club Section and it only gets better. The General Manager Michael has transformed this hotel in the last 12 months. We experienced a 23 hour delay from Newcastle on 13th May 2007 where we were treated like cattle, we eventually touched down in Sharm a day late, and within 2 minutes there were 3 buses and steps waiting for us to disembark - (English airports/people should take a leaft out of the Egyptians book regarding efficiency/courtesy/manners!) It was only the thought of returning to luxury which kept us going! A special THANK YOU must go to Natalia, Mohammed, Ahmed, Reda and Yousri Ali in the Regency Lounge and Mohammed at the Regency Club Pool. Also the breakfast omlette Chef. I can only re-iterate other reviews about the fab snorkling/hotel gardes and the Sala Thai restaurant.
reviews.title: Dissapointed in Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a week to chill and be spoilt then LOOK NO FURTHER THAN THIS HOTEL.
reviews.title: Little piece of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tour operator Mosaic kept us waiting at the airport an hour before taking us to our hotel, which was ten minutes away.
reviews.title: Food poisoning and building work

likes.liked: — Thai restaurant and the scuba/snorkling on the reef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prices in the restaurant same as London. Service was bad even if you tipped! 45 minutes for a ceasar salad. Both of us got food poisoning after eating at Cafe Fresco. Doctor on site but cost about 100 pounds for visit and medicine.Lots of other people got it too. Also chicken pox was going round amongst the kids as these thought less American parents allowed their sick child to swim and play with other kids.
reviews.title: Excellent Honeymoon!

likes.liked: — Service provided by staff & beachfront location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a letter shoved under the door informing us that the next day they were closing down the main pool for buiding repairs. That meant not only the noises and the view from Sala Thai and Cafe Fresco restaurant was a building site but the adult only quiet pool was opened to children. This is not a good hotel for kids. We were furious we hadn't been informed as we'd upgraded to this hotel from one which had the same problem. The internet service was 11 English pounds for 30 minutes and we just felt exploited!
reviews.title: fantastic resort!!

reviews.text: The jetty was not well manned and sometimes it didn't even have life saving equipment on it. The boats come in dangerously close, so keep an eye on your kids, don't assume the jetty guy is there or will.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff
Excellent in all aspects
reviews.text: The reef is great and the diving school brilliant - run by a great Brit girl called Rachel but she's leaving soon so I don't know what it will be like then.

aka: Hyatt Regency Sharm El Sheikh Hotel
description: Tipped as Egypt’s most lavish hospitality resort, Hyatt Regency Sharm El Sheikh combines ultimate luxury and exotic style on the edge of an aqua oasis in South Sinai. Three beach coves lead to one of the most spectacular diving sites, the Gardens Bay. The rooms are large and comfortable, with stunning sea views and all the comforts of modern living presented at the highest standards. Hyatt Regency Sharm El Sheikh’s many and various in-house facilities offer something for everyone; the array of bars and restaurants will satisfy the most discriminating gourmand, the Kid’s Club will keep the younger guests entertained while Club Olympus houses a fully equipped gym and aerobics studio and its Moorish style spa area offers sauna, steam bath, whirlpool and plunge pools.
